channel.title: Running my server.. Need Help :(
channel.description:
Ok i did the stickyed tutorial on creating a server and followed all the steps. And then i typed my ip in and it didn't work.
With the Batch file when i double clikc on it it says
error: cannot read: *.java 1 error Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: server Press any key to continue . . .
And then it exits.
Can someone help me as I really want to start my own server :(

item.title: Running my server.. Need Help :(
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

If what they’re saying doesn’t work, try this:

  1. Right-click ‘My Computer’.

  2. Select the ‘Advanced’ tab.

  3. At the bottom of this, there is a button ‘Environment Variables’. Click it.

  4. When this screen comes up, the top bit is 'User variables for “user” ’ and the bottom bit is ‘System Variables’.

  5. Under 'User Variables for “user” ', click the New button, and a box will come up called ‘New User Variable’.

  6. For the ‘Variable Name’, put “Classpath” - without the quotation marks of course (these things " ").

  7. For the ‘Variable Value’, put “SET CLASSPATH=C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.5.0_09\bin;%CLASSPATH%;.” remembering not to include the " " marks. Also note that the ; and . after the % symbol are MEANT TO BE THERE.

  8. Once this is done, click OK.

  9. Now under ‘System Variables’ you also need to make a new variable.

  10. Click the ‘New’ button once again, and another box will come up.

  11. For the ‘variable name’, put in “Path” - once again, no quotation marks ( " " these).

  12. For the ‘variable value’, put in “C:\Program Files\Java\JDK1.5.0_09\bin” - no quotation marks for this either.

  13. Done - now you have to change some things depending on your java version.

What to change:
As you can see with each of those, there is a section like JDK1.5.0_09 - the very last number is the version number. For me, it’s 9 as I have the latest version of Java installed. However, for you it mightn’t be.
Change that last number to whatever version is your latest that you have installed, and remember to make sure that those folders were actually installed in those locations, keeping in mind that the locations I have written above are the defaults when you install the Java version.

EDITED: Just changed the spacing for easier reading.

Read full topic

item.title: Running my server.. Need Help :(
item.dc:creator: @Crappyservermaker Crappyservermaker
item.description:
@Crappyservermaker wrote:

Go to your c:/ files

Program Folders
Java

If you have a file called
jdk1.5.0_09 Or some other number at the end like (jdk1.5.0_07),(jdk1.5.0_06)

Change that into your compiler

[quote=“mr candy, post:3, topic:17907”]ok then best avise i can give right click compiler then on edit type in this :
@echo off
COLOR 08
title YOURSERVERSNAME Server
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.5.0_09\bin\javac.exe” -cp . *.java
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.5.0_09\bin/java.exe” server
pause

with the 09 part change that depending one wich one you have say you have jdk 1.5 06 jsut change the 9 to 6 on both lines what should come up when its working is somthing like recompile with -xp then start server on …etc if this makes no sense call me a noob;)[/quote]

This would become your number v
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.5.0_09\bin\javac.exe” -cp . *.java
So would this v
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.5.0_09\bin/java.exe” server

Help’d?

EDIT: It doesnt have to be Candyscape lol, its your servers name

Read full topic

“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.5.0_09\bin/java.exe” server
pause

with the 09 part change that depending one wich one you have say you have jdk 1.5 06 jsut change the 9 to 6 on both lines what should come up when its working is somthing like recompile with -xp then start server on …etc if this makes no sense call me a noob;)
